task.summary: Default task
Performance optimizations.
Optimized checking of guess. Required replacing Scanner with Buffered Reader. This should make testing easier.
Small fixes, so as to comply with Sun's Java Conventions.
Small fixes, so as to comply with Sun's Java Conventions.
Small test for Game. Other tests will require files with input and output to compare.
A proper test for Game.java. (Includes respective debugs and restructuring of resource files.)
Replaced BufferedReader in Game.java with Scanner to simplify input reading. Re-wrote a test to account for new expected behaviour.
One more Game test for wrong guesses only.
Extracted some common operations into methods.

Replaced BufferedReader with Scanner to simplify method. Tests will still use BufferedReader, so as to make a difference between testing and implementation and guarantee that the system works as intended.
Minor fix, so as to comply with Sun code conventions (line length in this case).
Game test. Guessing the whole word from a single attempt.
Game test. Failing to guess the whole word multiple times.
Game test. Repeated guess has no effect.
Game test. Exit early has no Game Over message.
Game test. One letter hint.
Output remaining hints. Updated test expectations.
Game test. Run out of hints.
Game test. Case insensitive input. Also optimized hasLost().
Optimized GameTest.java.
Haven't been updating version...
Empty HangmanTest.java.
Small test for Hangman. Invalid lives amount. (and constant messages for that)
Extended Hangman to allow replays.
Hangman test with invalid hints.
Extracted replay to a separate method.
Making a difference between simulating a single game and an execution of the system (which can play multiple games).
Optimized tests by moving option initialisation in the OptionParse.parseAndValidate().
Optimized comparison. Argument is converted to lower case anyway, so simple .equals() should be more efficient.
Extracted common testing methods to a separate utility class.
Two more test for Hangman. One of which fails for some reason...
Came up with two more tests for Game. Also found out that the 'no' test in HangmanTest.java was passing for unexpected reasons... Thank you jacoco for pointing that out.
Fixed input reading issue. Hangman and Game can read the same stream. Game can re-access at any point. Tests pass.
Potential bug fix.
Test debug
Yes-No inputs for new game.
Unrecognized answer for new game.
Created a constant String containing the name of the folder with the expected outputs, so as to simplify tests.
Missing custom phrases test.
Final debugs thanks to FindBug.
Privatized a method that should not have been public.
Started report
Reached JavaDoc section of report and decided to add javadoc generation as a gradle task.
Empty guess test and debug.
Spaces should be automatically revealed (test and debug).
Report update (probably done with the Unit Test section).
Finished report.
Added javadoc generation command to README.txt
Forgot new line at end of README
